name: Update pinned requirements

on:
  schedule:
    - cron: '37 6 * * 1'
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  update_requirements:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - name: Checkout main branch
      uses: actions/checkout@v3
      with:
        ref: main
    - name: Create and switch to new branch
      run: |
        git checkout -b update-requirements
    - name: Set up Python
      uses: actions/setup-python@v4
      with:
        python-version: '3.10'
    - name: Install pip-tools
      run: |
        python -m pip install --upgrade pip
        pip install pip-tools
    - name: Generate requirements.txt
      run: |
        pip-compile --all-extras --output-file=requirements.txt --resolver=backtracking
        git add requirements.txt
        git commit -m "Update requirements.txt"
    - name: Create pull request
      uses: actions/github-script@v4
      with:
        github-token: ${{ secrets.GITHUB_TOKEN }}
        script: |
          const newPR = await github.pulls.create({
            owner: context.repo.owner,
            repo: context.repo.repo,
            title: "Automatically update `requirements.txt`",
            head: "update-requirements",
            base: "main",
            body: "This PR updates the requirements based on the latest versions of the dependencies.",
            maintainer_can_modify: true,
            merge_method: "squash"
          });
          await github.issues.addLabels({
            owner: context.repo.owner,
            repo: context.repo.repo,
            issue_number: newPR.data.number,
            labels: ["No changelog entry needed"],
          });
